title: Mathematical Models in Biology
description: Probability and deterministic models in biology, including discrete and continuous probability distributions and dynamic models from molecular and cellular biology to ecology and epidemiology.
restrictions: __HEADER_0__Must be enrolled in one of the following Campuses:
prerequisites: (MATH 1552 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or MATH 1555 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or MATH 15X2 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D) and ((MATH 1553 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or MATH 1554 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or MATH 1564 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or MATH 1522 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D) or (MATH 1502 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or MATH 1504 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or MATH 1512 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D)) and ((BIOS 1107 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or BIOS 1207 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D) and (BIOS 1107L Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or BIOS 1207L Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D)) or (BIOL 1510 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D or BIOL 1511 Undergraduate Semester Minimum Grade of D)
